finalMessage: Thanks for completing orientation. We look forward to seeing you in August!

items.title: Welcome to North Registration üëã
items.body:
We are excited for you to be a part of the North family for the 2020-2021 school year.  North High School has been a part of many school years since it started in 1886, but this one will be one of the most unique.  

Since we cannot have in-person registration due to health guidelines, we are asking you to complete registration online this year.  Registration consists of two parts that must be completed for each student:

1) North Orientation (All returning families and 9th grade families who did not complete this in the Spring must complete).  
2) Annual Family Update (All families must complete unless you completed it in the Spring)

You will simply click through this course to complete North Orientation and then you will complete Annual Family Update in Parent Portal.

If you need assistance at any point, you can go to www.tinyurl.com/nhsreg2020.

We will ask you a few questions along the way and registrations is intended to be completed with student and student guardian.

Please complete the registration process by Sunday, August 2 so that we can secure your seat for the 2020-2021 school year.

Thank you for being a part of the Viking Family!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

Estamos emocionados de que sea parte de la familia de North para el a√±o escolar 2020-2021. North High School ha estado presente durante muchos a√±os escolares desde que comenz√≥ en 1886, pero este ser√° uno de los m√°s singulares.

Debido a que no podemos tener inscripciones en persona debido a las pautas de salud, le pedimos que complete la inscripcion en l√≠nea este a√±o. La inscripci√≥n consta de dos partes que deben completarse para cada estudiante:

1) Orientaci√≥n de North (Todas las familias que regresan y las familias de noveno grado que no completaron esto en la primavera deben completar).
2) Actualizaci√≥n Anual Familiar (Todas las familias deben completar a menos que lo haya completado en la primavera)

Simplemente  tome est√© curso para completar la Orientaci√≥n de North y luego completar√° la Actualizaci√≥n Anual Familiar en el Portal para Padres.

Si necesita asistencia en cualquier momento, puede visitar www.tinyurl.com/nhsreg2020.

Le haremos algunas preguntas en el camino y las inscripciones deben completarse con el estudiante y el tutor del estudiante.

Complete el proceso de inscripci√≥n antes del domingo 2 de agosto para que podamos asegurar su lugar para el a√±o escolar 2020-2021.

¬°Gracias por ser parte de la familia vikinga!

Viking Family,

Before you begin the Registration process for the 2020-2021 school year, I want to name that there is a lot of uncertainty about how COVID-19 will impact the school year.  Please know that you are in good hands and that we will support each other through this time.

In the spring, we continued to support academic learning, we intentionally celebrated our seniors following social distancing guidelines, we raised over $13,000 to support families in need, and we served as a food distribution site.  It took all of us in the spring and it will take all of us this fall to continue to be an incredible community.

I am going into my 8th year at North High School and this will be my 6th year as the principal.  I am here for you, the North community.  I do not have all the answers and my team does not have all the answers for how we will navigate through these uncharted waters, but I know we can do it together just like Vikings have navigated uncharted and choppy waters for years before.  Please share any ideas, questions, or feedback so that we can be great for our students together.  I do not just want to survive in this season, I want to thrive and have this time continue to propel North forward.  

It will be essential that we remember a few things:
1) See the humanity in each other
2) Extend grace and kindness
3) Remain flexible

We have a solid foundation to build off of and we will provide the best learning experience possible for students following health and safety guidelines.  As Vikings, we will Row Together.

- Principal Scott Wolf

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Familias Vikingas,

Antes de comenzar el proceso de inscripci√≥n para el a√±o escolar 2020-2021, quiero mencionar que existe mucha incertidumbre acerca de c√≥mo COVID-19 afectar√° el a√±o escolar. Tenga en cuenta que est√° en buenas manos y que nos apoyaremos mutuamente durante este tiempo.

En la primavera, continuamos apoyando el aprendizaje acad√©mico, celebramos intencionalmente a nuestros adultos del Grado 12 siguiendo las pautas de distanciamiento social, recaudamos m√°s de $13,000 para apoyar a las familias necesitadas y servimos como un sitio de distribuci√≥n de alimentos. Nos llev√≥ a todos en la primavera y nos llevar√° a todos este oto√±o seguir siendo una comunidad incre√≠ble.

Voy a entrar a mi octavo a√±o en North High School y este ser√° mi sexto a√±o como director. Estoy aqu√≠ para usted, la comunidad de North. No tengo todas las respuestas y mi equipo no tiene todas las respuestas sobre c√≥mo navegaremos por estas aguas desconocidas, pero s√© que podemos hacerlo juntos al igual que los vikingos han navegado por aguas desconocidas y agitadas durante a√±os. Por favor comparta cualquier idea, pregunta o comentario para que podamos ser geniales para nuestros estudiantes juntos. No solo quiero sobrevivir en esta temporada, quiero prosperar y esta vez continuar impulsando a North hacia adelante.

Ser√° esencial que recordemos algunas cosas:
1) Ver la humanidad en cada uno de nosotros
2) Extender la amabilidad y el agradecimiento
3) Permanece flexible

Tenemos una base s√≥lida para construir y brindaremos la mejor experiencia de aprendizaje posible para los estudiantes que sigan las pautas de salud y seguridad. Como vikingos, remaremos juntos.

- Director Scott Wolf

items.body:
If you have questions about the information or policies you reviewed, please reach out to one of the following people:

- Elizabeth Gorka, Assistant Principal (Elizabeth_Gorka@dpsk12.org) 
- Marisa Lucio, Dean of Students (Marisa_Lucio@dpsk12.org) 
- Scott Wolf, Principal (Scott_Wolf@dpsk12.org)
--------------------------------
Si tiene preguntas sobre la informaci√≥n o las pol√≠ticas que revis√≥, comun√≠quese con una de las siguientes personas:

- Elizabeth Gorka, Subdirectora (Elizabeth_Gorka@dpsk12.org)
- Marisa Lucio, Decana de Estudiantes (Marisa_Lucio@dpsk12.org)
- Scott Wolf, director (Scott_Wolf@dpsk12.org)
items.prompt: Thanks for taking the time to review our policies!/ ¬°Gracias por tomarse el tiempo para revisar nuestras polizas

items.body:
In high school, your grades matter much more than they ever have before. While they always mattered for building skills, in high school they go on your official transcript, which will be viewed by employers, colleges, and considered for other future opportunities.  Please take time to review the graduation expectations.
----------------------------------
En la escuela preparatoria, tus calificaciones son mucho m√°s importantes que nunca. Si bien siempre importaron para desarrollar habilidades, en la escuela secundaria van en su expediente acad√©mico oficial, que ser√° visto por empleadores, universidades y considerado para otras oportunidades futuras. T√≥mese el tiempo para revisar las expectativas de graduaci√≥n.

items.body: As a 1:1 MyTech school, all North students are expected to use a district-issued Chromebook to assist with their learning. In a moment, you will be asked to review and accept the terms and conditions of the MyTech program.
items.title: Technology
Please review the device agreement

items.prompt: Both the student and guardian agree to the terms and conditions of the MyTech program and will take care of the Chromebook and charger (or will be responsible for the fees associated with the resources). Checking "Yes" below serves as your e-signature.
options: Yes
No

items.body:
It is essential that we work together as a team and that we have good communication from school to family, and family to school. There are many opportunities to get involved and we want you to be involved‚Äîyes, even at the high school level when many students no longer want their families involved!

We will try to communicate with you often, as we are a team! The following section will ensure you are set up to receive all of the relevant communications.
items.title: Teamwork and communication

items.prompt: Family communication
items.body:
We send out a family communication every Thursday to give you the information you need for the following week. You can make sure you're receiving this communication when you update your information in Annual Family Update.

In addition, we post timely updates to the Remind family groups. Please join the family group that is applicable for your student:
Class of 2021 - 
Class of 2022 - 
Class of 2023 - 
Class of 2024

Communication also always lives in Parent Portal and Schoology, where you can see up-to-date information about grades and attendance!

items.prompt: Review this document for more details on family communication

items.body:
Students should check their school email and Schoology messages every day, as these are the primary ways that we communicate.

Students can also receive timely updates by joining the student Remind groups.
Class of 2021 - 
Class of 2022 - 
Class of 2023 - 
Class of 2024 - 

Finally, students should check Student Portal to ensure accurate attendance is being taken.

For more information on the ways we communicate with students, please open this website in a new tab: https://sites.google.com/dpsk12.net/nhsguide/communication
items.title: Student communication

options: Collaborative School Committee (CSC) - Monthly Advisory Board Meetings at North
ELA-PAC / ELA-DAC - Supports English Language Learners
PTSA (Parent Teacher Student Association) - Supports programming at North
Event Committee (Homecoming, Prom, Etc) - Supports large events building community
Fundraising Committee - Raises funds for North
Family Ambassador - Shares info about North with new or potential families
Before / After School Programs - Provides clubs or tutoring opportunities for students
North Beautification Days - Cleans inside and outside - if we can have them
Staff Appreciation - Makes sure our staff feel appreciated!
items.prompt: As a family, how would you like to be involved at North this year? We expect each family to commit to at least one event, group, or opportunity.

items.title: Get to know the North counseling team!
Course Selection
items.body:
Courses are constantly being changed as we get ready for the school year.  Once schedules are ready to be viewed, we will communicate with families and students.  If you have any questions about your schedule, please reach out to your counselor.
*Last Names A - C - Melisa_Springsteen@dpsk12.org
*Last Names D - H - Jessica_Rodriguez@dpsk12.org
*Last Names I - M - Francince_Ruybal@dpsk12.org
*Last Names N - R - Kathleen_Hoffman@dpsk12.org
*Last Names S - Z - Joanna_Wood@dpsk12.net

One really great resource to make sure your skills stay sharp over the summer is Khan Academy. You can take practice SAT exams, the state exams at the high school level and learn content in any area. Schedule time each day to practice!

Students can sign in and create an account with their existing DPS log-in (through Google) if they have one already.

Open this link in a new tab to get started: https://www.khanacademy.org/
items.prompt: A helpful resource to keep your skills sharp over the summer
Set up your MySchoolBucks account to pay fees
items.body:
All Fees will be paid through MySchoolBucks. MySchoolBucks can be accessed through Parent Portal. If you have never used MySchoolBucks, you will need to create an account. You will not pay any fees at this time‚Äîinvoices will be generated in August and all fees need to be paid by the end of September. 

Fees for most families usually run around $60 and include the annual Technology Fee that pays for the student Chromebook and resource materials. If you cannot pay the fee or can only pay a part of the fee, we will absolutely work with you on this!

items.title: Potential School Fees - still being finalized

items.body:
The Free and Reduced Fee Application is often referred to as the free / reduced lunch form, but it provides more benefits than just lunch in the form of discounts or waived testing fees, activity fees and other opportunities. 

Be advised that, due to COVID-19 and job or monetary loss, you may not have qualified in the past, but may qualify now.

You can access the application by copying and pasting the link below.  You will also be asked to complete this during Annual Family Update, but you only need to complete it once.

https://www.myschoolapps.com/
items.title: Free and Reduced Fee Application

options: We completed the Free/ Reduced Fee Application
We will complete the Free/ Reduced Fee Application during Annual Family Update
We do not qualify for Free/ Reduced Fees and will be opting out
items.prompt: Free/ Reduced Fees
On-site Denver Health Clinic
items.body:
North High School has a Denver Health Clinic that is on-site. This clinic is open and available to all kids from birth to age 18. You can learn more about the clinic at the link below. We strongly encourage all families to consent their student to be seen by the clinic in case of an emergency, especially in this time of COVID-19.

All students can be seen for free for physicals, check-ups, and mental health supports. 

More info: https://www.denverhealth.org/services/school-based-health-centers

If you have questions about SBHC marketing or the e-consent links, please contact cori.depue@dhha.org

items.title: Denver Health Clinic Consent English (Open in a new tab)
Denver Health Clinic Consent - Spanish (Click to open in a new tab)

options: Yes
No
items.prompt: Did you fill out the online form to consent to having your student seen by the Denver Health Clinic?

items.title: Nice Work!
items.body: You are halfway to completion!  You will now fill out a final reflection to complete North Orientation and then you will go to Parent Portal to complete Annual Family Update!

items.prompt: Approximately how long did it take you to complete this section of Orientation?
options: Less than thirty minutes
Less than hour
More than one hour

items.prompt: What is one thing that you liked about Online Registration so far?
What is one thing we can do to make Online Registration better?
We know there is lots of uncertainty as we go into this school year?  What is on your mind?  What questions do you have?  How can we help to support you?
Is there anything else you'd like to share with us?  This is the last call before you move to Parent Portal to complete Annual Family Update.
Annual Family Update
items.body:
You have finished North Orientation and it is now time for you to complete Annual Family Update.  You will complete Annual Family Update through Parent Portal which can be accessed at the link below.

https://myportal.dpsk12.org/

If you have trouble with Parent Portal, reach out to our Family and Community Liaison, Graciela Guevara at Graciela_Guevara@dpsk12.org, call 720-423-2720, or text 720-504-6471 and she will help to support you getting it set up!

Your 20-21 Registration is not complete until you have finished Annual Family Update.  If you need support with anything, check out our support page below.

www.tinyurl.com/nhsreg2020

title: North High School - Registration (Draft)
